column4: Anyone know whay the Nvidia driver doesn't work on fiesty 64 bit? It crashed X. Is it because the driver is 32 bit?
yes
Is there a 64 bit driver available?
yes, there is. And probably you have it installed. The problem that is VERY unstable
neither in Windows you might have reliable 64 bit driver.
no. It is because it is not opensource.
if you are new to linux, I recommend you using a 32 bit instalation instead.
the difference is not noticeable from a common desktop usage.
I agree with Enselic
if you press TAB after typing Kurt my full nickname will be written
I have been using IRC very little and have yet to learn everything I need to for etiquette. My apologies.

you dont need to apologise :D In fact, that is not a matter of etiquette. It is a pratical issue. When you mention the full nickname of someone, usually, our message will me in a different color or will produce a sound, gathering the attention from the person you're talking to.
I just got tired of trying to correctly spell the name's and shortened them but now I know how to do it. :)
:P
Did you see my question about trying to use qtparted to resize the primary ext3 partition?
no... let me check
what is the problem ?
I want to reduce the size to create a fat32 partition for backup purposes for both OS's
you should be able to resize any ext3 partition only if it is unmounted
Just to do it. Not critical. Tried partition magic 8.0 and it sees the drive but won't touch it.
didn't think of that. It shows it's status as busy.
I am running knoppix so I will try it.
